svg.title: AUTO-ANNEALING · PRECISION ORBITS
svg.desc: Conceptual neon diagram on GitHub-dark background: establish a high-precision baseline (FP64), descend a precision ladder under quantization pressure, and lock into a lower-cost stable target (INT4) only when objective + stability gates remain satisfied. Stage 2 is upgraded with stepwise “validate-at-rung” motion, checkpoint lights, and rung pulses for a clearer, more intuitive animation.
svg.text: Conceptual: reduce precision under stability gates; lock in only when the objective still holds.

text.tspan: Baseline run with telemetry and artifacts.
Use it as the reference while stepping down
Only compare runs that pass stability gates.

g.text: Gate: objective metric defined + stability pass.

text.font-family: 'Segoe UI Mono', ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, monospace
'Segoe UI Mono', ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, monospace
'Segoe UI Mono', ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, monospace
'Segoe UI Mono', ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, monospace

text.tspan: Step down precision while tracking the
If behavior drifts, revert one rung.
Record artifacts so results stay comparable.

g.text: Ladder is configurable; shown as a common example.

text.tspan: Lock in only if the objective remains met
Else step back to the last stable rung.
Then rerun to confirm deterministic behavior.

g.text: “Stable” is defined by your contract’s fail gates.

svg.text: Diagram is illustrative. Acceptance requires measured telemetry + documented run artifacts.
